text: Robe blonde, mousse crémeuse et abondante. Nez puissant sur le houblon, les agrumes confits, les écorces dagrumes, sur un fond de céréales. Bouche tout en puissance et en amertume, bulle fine et amère et longue finale sur lamertume. Une très belle bière tout en amertume.

Bottle, 11C. Almost bright gold with a large white head that lasts well. Aroma of the meadow, under-ripe nectarines, oranges, crackers. Light bodied, high carbonation is maybe a bit too high for me (and better - creamier - after a swirl). Fruity and bittersweet with crackers verging on biscuit, oranges, nectarines, the meadow. Some tropical bubblegum, a touch of menthol. Doesnt come across as as bitter as XX and is confusingly both softer and more pungent. Second glass is barely hazier than the first - the sludgy sediment is very co-operative. Stunning.
Gyllengul mot orange öl med ett kvardröjande vitt skum. Doften är typiskt belgiskt jästig med deg, hö, gräs och viss pepprighet. I smaken tillkommer citrustoner och ljust bröd.

F: huge, white, good retention.
C: pale gold, light hazy.
A: malty, grassy, herbal, oranges, lemon, floral, tonic water, bit of yeast.
T: malty, grassy, oranges, grapefruit, floral, yeast, long lasting bitterness on the palate, apple, light soapy, medium body, medium carbonation, the bitterness is really nice in the way I like it, the XX was great for me and this XXX also, #1000 Belgium beer, 75cl bottle from Prik & Tik Dranken Marlou.
Light hazy golden with white foam on top. Powerful hop profile with some dry tea notes. Background honey and light cracker malt. Medium bodied with a lightly dry finish. Solid.
Hazy gold pour with a white head. Vanilla, warm spice and honey aroma. Flavours of vanilla, honey and apricot. Tasty.
Yellow color, huge white head. Gusher. Aromas of hay, floral hops, citrus, lemon peel, sour candy and yeast. Bitter taste of citrus, floral hops and yeast. Very bitter taste/finish. Not for me.
75cl bottle. hazy orange color. small white head. hops, citrus, pineapple, hint of pepper, tart. nice dry and bitter finish.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, fruit, grain, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Great standard Belgian Ale that could have something more. I am thinking of more fruity hops, some brettanomyces or spices. Great appearance and palate, but the aroma could have been stronger.

Totaal mijn ding niet. Totaal niet. Astringent in de slechte zin van het woord. Een alles overheersende scherpe hop. Teveel. Slaat alles plat. Ik kan me inbeelden dat dit godendrank is voor de fans. Ik ben het niet.

Bottle from Beergium. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, yeast, hops, earthy notes, a bit of ripe fruits and pine. Bitter finish with citrus, yeast, hops, white pepper, a bit of ripe fruits and pine. Very nice Belgian ale.
Sample. yellow beer. small head. aroma is hoppy fruit malt. Bitter taste is the same
From bottle. Hazy pale yellow with a nice white head. Hoppy, fruity and spicy. Nice but was expecting more.

Obfita, mydlana piana, szybko opadająca do chmurki. Barwa słomkowa, opalizująca. Aromat ziołowy, kwiatowy, dość delikatny. W smaku znacznie lepiej - półwytrawne, nuty ziołowe, kwiatowe i biszkoptowe kontruje wysoka, trawiasta, szorstka goryczka, która jednak bardzo pasuje do całości. W posmaku brzoskwinie. Średnie wysycenie, lekkie i pijalne w odbiorze.

Bardzo fajne piwo codzienne, zdecydowanie podobne do świeżego Hop Harvest.

Bottle. Etre Gourmet. Pale yellow. Soft haze. Thin, dense, lasting, bright white head. Nose is big on the bready, sweet Belgian yeast. Flowery and peachy. Some mineral. Some chalkiness. Taste has a fleeting, bready sweetness. Then theres a lot of grassy, leafy bitterness. Hop oily mouthfeel. Massaging and foamy at the same time. Long, grassy, leafy bitter finish. Missus found this too bitter. Result! More for me.

White foamy full lasting head. Deep golden colour. Aroma is hoppy with light fruity (apricot and pear) and light spicy notes. Flavor is hoppy too with apple and pear tones, ending in an hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle, 750 ml from MBR, Zagreb. Shared with Miro and JFK10000. pours clear golden with large white head. Light to average malty, perfumish, average yeasty, bit spicy. Lasting strong bitter finish. Medium bodied. Expected more.

THE GOLDEN BOY!!! Sicherlich eines der besten Belgian Ales ever, wobei seine EXTREME Hopfenbittere viel mehr auf ein grasig, verheftes IIPA hindeutet. HEISS!!!! Vom Hahn im FERMENTOREN Kopenhagen. 0,2/35DKK.

Bottle (750ml): Golden, cloudy, big and very stable rocky off-white head; distinctive - but still moderate - herbal-piney nose, yeast and a certain "belgian" fruitiness underneath; solid dry bitter flavour, medium bodied and soft; lingering piney finish, some yeast and some balancing pale malt detectable.Very good. Better than many " new" IPAS...

Tap at Pravda Kiev. Cloudy golden, nice creamy head. Really big aroma - cocktail of ripe fruit and wild herbs. Light pale malts and fruit in the taste, a very solid and sudden wormwood bitter kick on the finish. Not very sophisticated, but drinks well.
Auf der Biermesse in BXL getrunken. Sehr trübes Gold im Glas. In der Nase tropische Fruchtigkeit. Volle Bitterkeit im Antrunk, die aber schnell verfliegt.

On tap at Luppolo Station in Rome-Italy, on the day of the tap takeover. Cloudy golden pour, incredible white foam with drafts on the glass. Nose: spices, ripped fruit, noble hops blast! Mouth: oily hoppy notes, bitterness, round bitter feel with spicy notes. Yes!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Proefglas van 75cl-fles op Horeca Expo te Gent. U: Sterk wazig blond met een grote witte schuimkraag. G: Hoppig, iets floraal, wat bleekmout en lichte gistgeur. S: Stevige bitterheid in combinatie met fruitige hop, wat granen en wat gist. Licht astringent in de afdronk. Frisse dorstlesser. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.
Blond with light haze. Aroma an flavour are less impactful that the XX version. This time its very light up front with very dry, floral hop coming through in the aftertaste.

August 2016 - Bottle share at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig, Day 1. Thanks! As De Ranke XXX Bitter. Dark yellow, hazy, lightly sparkling, foamy off-white head, dotted lacing. Aroma is dusty, crackers, light mint. Body is light, foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is tonic water, cracker malts, straw, earthy, spicy. OK. A bit light bodied and thin but it grew on me. (3.3)

Clear golden color with thick white head. Aroma has some yeast, malt, pine, grape. Taste is malty with quite long bitter and a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of malt, grass, pine. High bitterness. Combination of both worlds.
Pours in golden yellow colour with small white head. Aroma of yeast, leather, sour milk. Strongly bitter, lightly sweet. Medium body, thick feel, long bitter aftertaste.
0.25 sample. Pours unclear orange color with high, mostly lasting white head. Citrus, flowers, hoppy aroma. Flavor is high bitter, medium sweet. Long bitter finish. Average carbonation, medium body.

Sampled from bottle at Maakuns. Slightly hazy golden. Thin white head. Sweet malts, big bitter grassy hops, something popcorn like. Medium sweet over medium bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Floral and bitter finish.

Big bottle shared. Slight hazy light golden with big fluffy white head. Massive dank grassy hops, some lime and orange peel, soft caramel, light chicory. Super hoppy! Almost medium sweet and over medium bitter. Medium bodied. Hopped to hell and back, really like it.

Dorado turbio y espuma blanca. Aromas dulces y frescos de fruta amarilla y manzana verde, también pino y menta. Cuerpo medio y sabor dulce de inicio de fruta amarilla, ligera acidez y final seco y de amargor largo.
Hazy yellow-golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma, some citrus and a grass note. Fruits and yeast in the taste, also something spicy. Nice one.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 75cl. Light hazy yellow golden pour with initially frothy head. A: nicely balanced hop profile with citrus, lime, pine, orange zest. Nice light malty presence. Inviting, refreshing, very subtle (positive!). T: upfront bitterness with citrus fruit elements. Hops profile mellows down, makes way for a refreshing maltiness (hay, fresh grain notes), medium bitter development with orange zest, citrus notes, some mint even. Finish is moderately bitter, some malts and fresh grains, orange zest bitterness. Great balance from start to finish.

750ml bottle. Milky, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting an dlacing, white head. Fruity yeasty and fruity hoppy aroma, notes of peach, apricot, mirabelle, biscuity, doughy and minimally bready malty basis, hints of white bread crust, slightly peppery and minimally dusty, yeasty spicy overtones. Taste is bitter hoppy, slightly fruity, fairly peppery spicy, slightly cautious hints of peach and apricot; lasting bitter finish, lively, fine carbonation.

bottle @ Keg Liquors / Clarksville IN --- EXP 02/05/18 --- Aroma of grass and light malt, along with flowery bitter. Cloudy medium / light amber, white head that moves easily to a cover, blobs of lace. Taste is surprisingly bitter. Some malt and a little hay, maybe a little clay, medium carbonation. But, mostly herbal hops. Balance isnt there in a brew that otherwise has strong attributes.

Bottle @ home. Dorata carica, velata, quasi opalescente. Aroma intenso.fine e piutttosto complesso. Lievito belga, zucchero candito, cereali, floreale di margherite, erbaceo da luppolo. Secca, amara, pochissima acidità nessun accenno sapido. Cereali, erbaceo e floreale sono i gusti primari. poco calda, carbonatazione intensa, Spigolosa, watery, molto dissetante. Equilibrata ed armonica.
Bottle at Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF Shindig, 2016 (Sunday sesh.). Hazy gold pour with a white head. Vanilla, warm spice and honey aroma. Flavours of vanilla, honey and apricot. Tasty.

I was asked to give my opinion on the De Ranke XXX.

What should have been a great beer was spoiled to the over-bitterness, most probably from dry hopping for too long. I have made this mistake a few times as well.Pity

75cl bottle from paisley beer festival
 pours a golden colour with a white foaming head
 aroma is heavily hopped bit citric bit sweet spice
 taste is bitter but not as bitter as i had expected,bit fruit long bitter dry finish
 overall bit disappointing ,not as bitter as the xx bitter
Bottled, hazy golden pour , malty breaDy citrus nose, fruity pineapple , smooth bitter, yeast, good finish
On tap at The Sovereign. Slightly cloudy appearance. Belgian aroma with good hop character.
Duft svag duft citrus lidt græs malt, smag citrus malt frisk bitter eftersmag lidt grøn

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Rich golden hazy to opaque amber with a large fluffy white head which dissipates to thin, lacing up the sides of the glass with foam. Nose is rich golden toasted grains, toasted French bread, bitter, fruity hop. The hop is floral, very grassy, citrusy and with something exotic like lychee or kiwi mixed in with nettle. Some Belgian yeast ester in the nose too, with very subtle shades of banana and ripe fruit. Ive not tasted it alongside XX Bitter but I suspect the malt is richer and more robust, but could be wrong. On the taste its a base of golden grains, otasted grains, sweetness, French bread and then the bitteness quicks in quickly with grapefruit acidics, nettle, lots of grassiness, and something floral or tropical. The bitterness lingers on the tongue. Balance is beautiful in this.

Bottle from Beermania. Murky orange, large creamy head. Aroma yeast, hops. Taste: immediate super dry attack, lasting until long finish, gradually adds grapefruit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a yellow / golden ale, very low white head. Nose is medium, and mainly yeasty. Taste of grain and yeast. Texture is medium, low carbonation, bitterness is progressive from medium to strong in the end.

On tap at Paris Beer Week 3-- Pours hazy golden with thin white head. Nose is yeasty. Aromas are sweet malts, fruits,herbal and spicy hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Long fruity and bitter finish.

Zythos 2016. Pours in pale body with medium head. Aroma has citrus upfront, little bit grassy. Taste has higher bitterness with grassy sweetness, lemon, zest, well balanced. Body is full, medium carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with big white head. Aroma is floral hops, spicy peppery yeasts. Taste is hay, grass, floral hops, oily mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Beautiful.

Bottle from Sip in Tallinn (was around  10). BB 2021. Didnt write down much, but the overall impression was: grassy (raw) bitter and fruity, very dry and nearly aggressively carbonated. Luckily, the mild sweetness kinda manages to bury the raw hop character. Very nice anyway.

Bottle, shared by kauge thanks. Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, cucumber, apricots. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, apricots, malt, Finish is dry bitterness. Overall: very good.

Bottle shared by Mart. Hazy golden yellow beer, medium retentive white head. Nose is citric, malty, hoppy, creamy, mild caramel notes, grass. Flavor is hoppy, grassy, bitter, fruity, refreshing, light sweetness. Herbal-fruity finish, grass notes, hops, dryness.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Pale, bit hazy yellow colour. Modest white head. Aroma of hay and hops. Hoppy at first. Bitterness in the middle. Hoppy finish. Bit spicy aftertaste. Well balanced saison. Does not have flowery wheat basis. Hops making this beer good but the palate is not complex. It is still very well drinkable beer.

Not 4.0 because of the slight sweetness. Chsracteristics were the same at the second tasting.

750ml bottle (Koht Tallinn)
Lovely fresh hoppy aroma. Super fresh crisp hoppy taste. Lovely mellow palate, but full of character, soft bready malts, but super perfumey hops. Balance absolutely perfect. This is like a mellowed version of the XX. To be honest, I think I prefer the smack in the chops of the XX.

750ml bottle. Bit hazy golden color. Medium size, bubbly white head, stays. Sweet malts, bit of hazelnuts, floral, some plastic in aroma. Malty, sweet, spicy and grassy hops in taste. Hops absolutely explode in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Hopping is exceptionally well done. Very very good bitter.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à la brasserie,
couleur blonde mousse et effervescence bien présente,
Nez sur le hoblon et le citron presquun côté cannabis.
Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam
Ouais ça faisait un mois que javais pas bu une bière, jai trouvé ça bon et jai pas eu envie de me faire chier à la noter.
Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam Miam

Cloudy, yellow colored, medium white creamish head, good lacing. Aroma is of malt, citrus, spicy phenolic and bit straw. Taste is medium to light sweet malt, light caramel, lots of spicy phenolic-peppery notes and citrus, some straw, medium to strong bitterness, quite dry finish. Medium- bodied, average carbonation, oily. Proper Belgian bitter stuff!
(on tap, Gainsbar, Kortrijk)
Not a belgian fan....but this works for me! Enough hops to remind me of prima pils. Nice.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Blonde, effervescence moyenne. Enorme houblonnage intense du début à la fin de la dégustation. Parfaite pour les amateurs damertume.

At Bruges Beer Fest. Pours hazy blonde with a big white head. The aroma contains hops, citrus, grass, yeast and earthy notes. It tastes medium sweet towards heavy bitter. The aftertaste is strong, lasting, dry and bitter. Lively carbonation. A bit too intense.

Amarelo escura, media turbidez, espuma branca de média formação e persistência. Aroma de lúpulo tipicamente belga, seca, doce de mamão, pêssego, complexa. Paladar de médio amargor e leve dulçor. Corpo médio, seco, média carbonatação. Aftertaste trás um dulçor frutado/seco, de média persistência. Uma cerveja de classe, percebe-se a qualidade da fabricação. Perfeita para uma harmonização.
bottled dec14. Golden colour with a firm head. Aroma is dust, grass, earth, hey and dry hops. Dry, little bit acidic with long bitter finish. Nice one
Draft. Large off-white head atop lightly hazed amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, orange/spicy, light bread. Taste is moderately sweet, orange, light spicy, bread. Medium body, light chalk.

For the third time in the world and for the second time in Sweden this beer is released to the public. 

Released at Systembolaget in October 2015. Only about 700 75cl bottles found its way to Sweden this time. 
Ive saved this for a rainy day and thats today!  (January 29 - 2016) 

The beer pours hazy, light yellow with a huge, three finger high, white head that leaves lacing on the glass. 

The beer is full of very small bubbles racing to the top of the beer. It reminds me of a glass of champagne. 

Nose: Funky Belgian yeast, floral hops, malt (pilsner malt?), grass and some earthy notes. I love the smell! 
Taste: Wow! This is good! A lot of bitterness. Pale malt, citrus, grapefruit, bread, coriande and floral hops. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Great texture. Medium carbonation. High bitterness and dry ending. The bitterness really plays a big part in this beer! 

What can I say? I love bitter beer and this is bitter! The beer takes a grip of your tongue and twist it... Nice! 

Im so glad I got hold of a few bottles.

Color pesca, opalescente, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza.
Aroma di pompelmo, lievito belga, floreale ed erbaceo.
Al palato attacca dolce con lievito belga, misto a pompelmo, coda erbacea è contraddistinta sempre da pompelmo, leggermente resinosa.
Corpo medio, ben carbonata, texture acquosa.

75cl fles. Helder blond bier met wandklevend fijn wit schuim. Geur: Sulfer, niet zo frisse geur. Met wat zuurstof verdwijnt dit gelukkig. Smaak: wat aards, bitter. Afdronk: bitter, lang. Ik ben fan van de XX Bitter maar dit was teleurstellend. Deze moet en zal ik zeker herproeven!

hazy yellow colour, huge off-white head; aroma of floral notes, bread, some citruses fruitiness and coriander; taste is the same with intensive bitterness - similarly to the XX version: would be better with a bit less intensive hoppy bitterness

750ml bottle. Semi-clear golden with three finger airy white head. Descrete floral hoppy aroma with citrus, grass and hay. Taste is very bitter with plenty of grapefruit and citrus zest, bitter lemon and grapefruit, grass and straw. Medium, slightly rough from the bitterness, mouthfeel, medium-light carbonation and strong bitter aftertaste.
Moderate malty, heavy hoppy. Apple, pear, white wine, pepper. Good lacing. Medium body, heavy astringent.
From notes on 9/15/15. I actually liked the XX more. Yes, this beer is more bitter, but Im not getting the sweetness that I got from XX, which I liked. Still, pretty tasty.
75 cl systembolaget. En helt ok öl med klassisk belgisk jästsmak och fällning. Trots detta gillar jag den
Cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Hoppy and fruity tones. Fruit, spices, malt and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter / spicy finish.

750ml bottle at home, 5th December 15. Bottled April 2015. Pours a hazy straw colour, nice neat head, not over carbonated as I thought it could be. The aroma is hay, yeast, green hops, funk, floral notes. Taste is a perfect mix a bitter, hoppy, grass, hay, yeasty delight. Lingering bitterness with a slight caramel finish in the mouth. Lovely. De Ranke do these beers so well

Big bottle from web SB cons 2015-12-04 Gäteborg
AR: really sour, farmhouse, gooseberries, citrus 
AP: clear coppery, high lively fluffy chemical white
F: sharp carbonation, sharp yeastineess, farmhouse, citrus, bitter,

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, long lastning white head, good lacing. Yeast and citrus nose. Smooth and bitter mouthfeel. Some floral bitterness, belgo yeast, mid-hoppy with citrus notes.
Jästig doft med toner av pulverkaramell. Lätt kropp med tydlig beska. En aning karamell men sötman håller sig i bakgrunden. Beskan hänger kvar länge.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving soapy lacing. Skunky resin aromas. Crisp with bread, hay and caramel upfront turning to bitter pith and resin in the abrupt finish.

Pours hazy hayishly yellow with low white head
Aromas of hay, belgo yeast, sour citrusy fruits, mandarins
Taste has bitter herbal hoppyness, hay, wheat, citrus.
High carbonation, medium bitterness, dry
750ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a white head. Lemon, peach and some grapefruit zest in the aroma. Bitter, zesty and tangy taste with grapefruit, lemon, yeast, peach and some floral notes.

Pours hazy golden with fairly tall white head. Aroma of honey, citrus, light herbs, hay and funk. Taste is fairly rich bitter with a fruity undertone. Lingering bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Pale, translucent, bright goldl color. No head ever. Smells natural and like belgian yeast but not danky. Flavor is bitter with minimal sweetness and a lot of dry mineral earthiness with the natural yeast character shining through. Very simple and uncomplicated. Delicious and no aftertaste.

quite boozy, heavy brash bitterness, leafy, herbal, pine, musty hop sacks, long bitter finish.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Pours a clear yellowy orange with a good, white head. Aroma is flowers and plastic, Belgian hops. Taste is dry, flowery, grass, dry.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at Stadin Panimobaari, 20150919) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had Belgian style yeast, grass and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were Belgian style yeast, herbalness, grass, fruitiness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste had yeast, hops and bitterness. A well done hoppy brew showing the hop characteristics but was not overdone.
Jai gouté peu de difference avec la XX Bitter. Disponible en 75cl uniquement, ce qui ne facilite pas la degustation.

Draft at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours cloudy blond with a big white head. Aroma of grassy and weedy hops, light yeast, dough and citrus. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and heavy bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Aroma: Grain, pear/golden malt, floral, yeast, light roasted grain.
Flavor: Pear and golden malt, roasty grain, floral notes. A sustained 2 minute malt and bitter hop finish.
Comment: Almost champagne-like carbonation and yeast character. Superb.
Tap @ Blue Monk. Hazy yellow work thin white head. Smells light and citric with a floral hint. Floral then biter flavor.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear pale golden, nose is toffee, floral, taste is similar, dry, light sweetness.

75 cl bottle @ home. Clear blond beer with a big aery head. Smell is very grassy, citrus, floral, herbal. Medium carbonation. Taste is very grassy, citrus, herbal, dry and bitter. Aftertaste is grassy again, dry, quite bitter, not bad, but a bit dull.

Pours golden yellow clear, slightly haze colour with creamy white head, which immidiatelly dissapeared. Visually high carbonation.
Aroma without notice of an alcohol. Dominate smell of grape, oranges, lemon and some spices, which I can not identify.
Similar is taste, very spicy, almost sour-sweet, with dry bitter finish. Prevails taste of lemon, oranges, grape. 
Malt sweetness is low, bitterness is medium, carbonation is soft. Also body.
Interesting belgian ale, reminds me on traditional belgian sasion.
Unusuallc hoppy for a Belgian ale, citrus ambee body. Quite nice beer. On tap at MoederLambic
Nice hoppy aromas and flavours. Citrus aromas. Nice citrus and grassy flavours. Solid Belgian ale.

750 ml. bottle about 7 months from bottling date. It pours a clear pale gold color with large white head that shrinks fairly quickly. The aroma is full with noble hops. Spicy, earthy, light lemon, apricot and pine. Good background notes of dusty yeast. The flavor is pretty much the same with strong earthy, spicy hops with hints of stone fruit, grass, toasted grains and a lightly earthy, menthol like bitterness in the finish. Rather creamy on the palate with some subtle phenols that play nicely with the intense hop character. If you enjoy noble hops (I do) and interesting yeast character (I really do) then this is the beer for you. Really enjoyable, but a bit on the expensive side.
75 cL bottle. Golden orange with a bubbly head. Lovely fruity floral aroma. Dry, biscuity, with a hint of butterscotch, very pleasant. Tasty but very, very dry.

On tap @Bir&Fud (Rome). Pours golden with a big white head. Aroma is very hoppy, citrus and grass, yeasts, malt (bread, cereals), nice! Flavour is light sweet with a strong and persistent bitter end, fresh, clean, crisp and tasty! Medium body, medium to strong carbonation. A very good beer, modern and in very good condition (finally...)
75 cl bottle. Hazy orange with small white head. Hoppy, grass, pepper aroma. Sweet flavour leading to a long strong bitterness with spicy notes

Bright yellow pour, billowy white head, nice lacing. Nose is hops, Euro variety. Middle is light Pilsner malt, scouring hop bitterness. Finish is dry and long. Found this at Central Market on Lamar about a week ago. Good.

Dec 2014 750ml bottling. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy light to medium yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (cracker / toasted grain), moderately to heavily hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of lemon zest, pepper, gum, dried pineapple. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, heavily bitter. Medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly astringent.

FINALLY a reasonably fresh bottle of this, but of course I had to order it online from Belgium because American importers and distributors suck horribly at getting anything like this to retailers in less than a year anymore, especially Shelton Bros stuff. So yeah...this is obviously 4+ material, thats instantly obvious from the first sniff and sip. Hard to want much more out of an aroma...its bright and offers notes from every aspect of the brewing process...malt, hops, yeast, esters, phenols, and theyre all of the enticing sort. In the mouth its eye-openingly bitter (damned near too bitter), but theres plenty of residual sugar to keep it delicious. And its a very clean, low-acid, low-astringency type of dryness that is hard to complain about. It doesnt have the massive, rocky, meringue-like head or ultra-fluffy mouthfeel I expected but these are minor quibbles...this is world-class brewing beyond doubt.

In bottiglia da 75cl. Aroma speziato, frutta gialla, erbaceo, erba appena tagliata. Al palato gasatura un pò eccessiva, poi sentori di speziato, pepato, erba appena tagliata, resinoso e finale molto amaro senza perdere bilanciamento.

I love love the xx bitter, so was pretty excitable to see this .. Opened at the Nguyen baby shower .. Hazy gold Amber .. Lots of splattered foam ., hay, dried grass, mild earthy yeast, and bitterness .. Not as subtle as the regular offering, but still nice, Id take the xx bitter over this .. . . Its a mirage, its sabotage

Bottle. Hazy golden yellow beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, peaches, oranges, spices and apricots. Flavor is fruity with notes of citrus, grapefruit, peaches, spices and grass. Well balanced.

Bottle; Pour is murky light gold, with a two finger, fine bubbled white head into this glass. It retains fairly well, with sticky lacing presence here. The nose is a floral bouquet, with grassy hops, spent grain is there as well. The flavor profile is hop bitter indeed - grassy, bready malts, feint pepper spice, floral notes with a touch of lactic here. This was a fun attempt, but it just doesnt quite work out for me

75cl bottle shared. Pours light hazy golden with one finger of white head that leaves some lacing on the glass. Aroma is sweet malts, yeast, spices and, some flowery note. Taste starts similar almost immediately overwhelmed by a lot of vegetal hoppy bitterness. Strong, very long bitter aftertaste, dry finish. Medium body, lively carbonation. Did I say this thing is bitter?
ath zythos beer festival along with Yves golden blond colored body with a white head and with a spicy yeast hops aroma a hop fruity bitter taste with a bitter finish

Shared with wim at Zythos bierfestival 2015. Clear blond colored beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Yeasty hopped aroma. Full slightly sparkling palate. Finish is is hopped very bitter and bit dry ending.

750ml bottle picked up in Japan. Pours out a hazy straw color topped with a small head. Nose is floral hops belg yeast and a nice spice. Taste is more of the heavy floral notes spice is heavy and a good belg kick.
old hoppy aroma,yellow,clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, old hoppy finish.

Bottle. Clear golden, whitish head. Grassyness, herbal and hoppy notes in aroma. Bitter grapefruity and piney forresty notes in taste. Some fruityness and maltyness later on with a long bitter finish.

Started out as a clear golden color with a thick white head, the body grew cloudy as the natural yeast was disturbed. Aroma was a mix of toasted and biscuit malts, esters, floral and bitter hops. Flavor had nice fruity Estes and a nice sense if bitterness and tartness. Yeast and hops paired very well. Nice carbonation. Slightly dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Special version of the XX Bitter De Ranke, brew with 50% more hops. Very bitter (70 IBU), very aromatic. However, the difference between XX and XXX is not that big.
Yellow coloured and hasy. Has a white head, lasting. Aroma is hoppy and yeasty. Flavor too.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate malty and hoppy flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Gedronken op bierfestival in Brugge 2015. Goudgeel met een witte kraag. Smaak en geur zijn hoppig maar niet echt fruitig meer dennen. Volle body.

75cl Bottle from Melgers. Golden colour, white head. Lovely hoppy aroma, classic Belgian hops, lots of fresh grass, flowers, lavender, sage, all the good stuff. Flavour is very floral, light spicy, malty, dry, wet grass, herbal in the sense of lavender/sage/rosemary, etc. Dry bitter finish. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation. I love these kind of beers, just all malty and hoppy goodness. Btw it appears to be more mellow than the XX Bitter, less soapy.

Bottle @ Kafe Belgie, large sample. Hazy yellow color, medium frothy white head. Aroma is quite spicy from belgian yeast and with loads of flowery hop. Medium bitter in taste, bit dry. Bitterness lingers on. Extremely powerful hopped belgian blonde. Dont know if I prefer this one above the excellent regular XX Bitter. Think this one goes a bit over the top and out of balance.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a huge off-white head. Aroma of yeast, some floral notes, sugar and herbs. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some bitterness, herbs, some floral notes and spices. Medium body, average carbonation.

Crystal-clear golden beer with a weak white head and some cute bubbles.
Smell is dominated by citrus. White pepper, bread and a saison-like floweriness. Subtle touch of leather and cherries. Metal, resin.
Taste is bitter bitter bitter but deliciously balanced. Watery. Astringent finish which lingers developing a subtle floweriness.
Tap. Clear golden pour with a thin but nice white head. Citrus, floral, pine, spice, wet spring leaf. Medium to full body. Short crisp and refreshing finish. Interesting

A golden beer with a quite big and blond head. The aroma is fresh and fruitful, citrusfruits, perries, aromatic hops, flowers, some spices. Taste is fruitful and strongly hopped, sourness of lemon and spices. More bitterness in the end, thus the taste is quite dry, some herbs, long bitterness in the mouth. Medium bodied, strong carbonation. If I remember correctly, the XX Bitter was fresher. Strongly hopped but still balanced and the great belgian elements arent hidden. The great beer.
75cl bottle shared with a friend. Pale yellow/orange with a full white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bittersweet taste. Citrus, herbs, hops and yeast. A decent Belgian brew.
Draught @ Cafe Rose Red, Brugge. Pale amber-orange in colour with light citrus lemon notes alongside pale malts.
à comparé absolument avec la xx bitter. Malgré un houblonnage plus intensif laccent est mis sur le late hooping et du coup lamertume semble moins importante même si ce nest pas le cas

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2016 Limited special version of the classic XX Bitter, since 2013, with stable, snow white head and deep golden blonde colour. Aroma of apricot, grapefruit, tonic water, orange peel, apple, grass; dry fruity onset, citrussy freshness, after which a strong, long and dry, complex citrussy hop bitterness sets in, peppery and spicy, like in the regular version. Not necessarily hoppier or more bitter than the XX, but hoppy in a different, more American kind of way, I suspect.  I need to do a side by side tasting of both...
2014.11 - fles 75cl - bij Cis, fles van Wim - mooi weelderig wit schuim, helder goudkleurig - beetje geur van het putje (doch niet storend) - bijzonder smaakvol en bitter, of wat dacht u

Bottle from bieresgourmet.be webshop. Pours a hazy pale yellow body with a large white head. Nose is citric peel, grapefruit, straw, lime, lemon and hints of pale malts. Taste is pale malts, citric peel, bitter herbs, resin, grass and hints of straw, Belgian ale yeast and grapefruit. Medium body, high carbonation. Nice, citrusy and refreshing; this version carries the bitterness better than the regular XX bitter IMO.
On draft at ChurchKey in D.C. Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus and spices. Flavors of tropical fruits with some dusty notes. Bitter finish.

Keg at Pressklubben, Stockholm.  Hazy golden, small head. Rich aroma of grassy hops. Dry and lightly fruity with medium body and firm, vital mouthfeel. Lots of grassy hops, notes of grain and marzipan. Long bitter finish. Superbly drinkable and elegant.

4 oz draft pour at ChurchKey. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, light tropical and stone fruit, floral notes. Tastes of citrus fruit and peel, bitter and piney notes, light tropical fruit, floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish.
Sampled @ Finest Spirits and Beer Convention Bochum 2014: Trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner weißer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr grasig, hopfig, frisch. Geschmack bitter grasig, hopfig, frisch.

Spina @ la notte della mummia.
Chiara con schiuma non troppo persistente.
Molto amara, secca.
Luppolo evidente ma non invadente.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle @ benzai. Clear yellow colour with a medium to large white head. Smells like a pub on Stratumseind where lots of these alternative/metal guys gather after smoking some marihuana, after making abstract dance moves to their devillish metal music in their poster decorated dorm rooms. Sweaty, pilsener, urinal, marihuana. Tastes bitter, grassy hops, marihuana. Thin to medium body, nice crisp carbo.
Bottle @benzai with benzai and dutchdrebus. Clear golden color with a white head. Smells pils, some wheat, yeast. Tastes malts, bitter, pils, boring.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Clear golden color, full sized rough white head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is malts, a bit yeasty, European hops. Taste the same: malts, yeasty, European hops, decently bitter, especially in the aftertaste. Average body, medium carbonation.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Clear gold slight haze. Fresh light grapefruit aroma. Touch of soap in flavour. Almost a little watery in the pale malts. Good hops yes good bitterness yes drinkable yes. But lacking a little hop backbone. The hops are balanced and supported ok it?s just a tad watery in the mouthfeel which is amazing to get away with normally beers this hoppy but with little malt flounder but this is good. Just think it may be better with more malt. Hops are excellent though

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint fruitiness, some grassy - herbal hoppyness. Body is medium, malty - lightly wheaty and dryish flavor, faint fruitiness and toffee, grassy hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty - faintly wheaty and dryish, lots of grassy - herbal hoppyness. Nice one, but not as good as regular XX. This one is softer/lightly sweeter with light notes of wheat and faint toffee.

Maybe its the keg, but this version didnt taste all that more bitter to me than the bottled XX a couple of years ago. Pours green-inflected honey yellow. Grassy and bready aromas are well tucked away in a near-elegant malt body, with green and grassy, herbal hops permeating all the way, although never tasting dank or palate-numbing. Not much particular yeast finesse here as in XX. Fruity malt notes and some shy citrus rind make for very easy quaffing. Gentle, monodimensional De Ranke overall - interesting this should be a US export only .

Has cloudy, pale yellow color, with small, persitant head.

Aromas of grassy hops with a hint of pine above a spicy yeast base, which inherits a decent, slightly funky sourness.

Taste is defined by a crisp, really bitter hoppiness, while fruity hints blend together well with the spicy, funky yeast. The brew is always in great balance, even during the finish, in which the hops turn a little slick and even more bitter, very dry but still balanced by earthy, almost wooden malts. Surprisingly bitter, pointing into an american IPA direction, considering the processed hop-onslaught.

Bottle. Thanks to my buddy Jack for picking this up for me while on vacation in Oregon last month. Sadly, we no longer get De Ranke in NC. This beer does not disappoint. A tad sharper and more bitter than the XX. Pours orange with small white head that fades much faster than expected. Quite dry, sparkling, super crisp, straw, crockery malt balanced perfectly with herbal, earthy hops and that unmistakeable De Ranke yeast. Fuck yes. I need to find more bottles of this instant gem.

On tap at Örebro Ölcafé. Herbal and hoppy smell with a grassy aroma. Similar taste, hoppy with grass, herbs and hops. I also get something that reminds me of bubble gum. Strong bitterness. Slightly rough mouthfeel.
Dimmig, citron safts gul med ett tätt, vitt skum. Doft: Gräs, växter, humle, jäst,malt. Smak: Som doft + belgo.

Bottle @ home. Backlog. Pours hazy orange with a fizzy white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, yeast, toast and some hay. Bitter up front. Grass, pine, oranges, wheat and white bread flavor. Finish is dry and has some coriander and a lasting assertive grape-like bitterness.

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy golden hue with fizzy shire head. Aroma is spicy hops, huge lemon, grassy, ripe limes. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a nice bitter following and dry finish. Overall this is a good brew.
Bottle. Low fluffy white and quickly disappearing head. Hazy dark yellow body. Odd malt straw bread aroma. Dry and powerful malt straw grass grapefruit pine flavor. High carbonation. Long dry finish.

Draft at Churchkey, 7/12/14. Pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of dry pale malt, floral and herbal hops, jammy fruits. The taste is honey, herbal and floral hops, pale malts. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness.

In aroma its mostly hoppy and malty. Its bright yellow color, a little bit hazy, with small head. In taste there is nothing else but bitterness. Its not moderated or covered by anything. Its very long but quite pleasant. The beer is very refreshing but runny in taste.
Grasig bitterer Antrunk, leicht herb. Dann deutlich bitterer werdend, Limette, Zitrone. Trocken bitteres Finish mit immer noch starkem Hopfen. Gut! 11/11/12/12/9/12

Aroma: average bread malts, light dough. Appearance: cloudy light yellow, small creamy white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: medium body, long bitter finish. Overall: very nice Belgian Ale, nice palate, light sour in aroma. Pint at the GBBF 2014, Kensington.

Keg at 2014 GBBF. Saturday dregs tick and run. Hazed golden straw with a big frothy white head. Aroma is fresh, floral hop, Belgian yeast and straw. Flavour is clean straw, Belgian yeast, clean and fresh. Bitter earthy bitterness. Palate is light and effervescent. Good.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic,Fontainas. Pours yellow with a white head, leaving some lacing. Aroma of malt, hops, grass and citrus. Flavor is malt, rather bitter grassy hops, flowers, citrus. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 310714

75 cl bottle thanks to Kusabusa! (not on ratebeer). Sampled on August 10, 2014.A bit hazy golden color, flussy white head. Hoppy, bitter, grassy, grape peel taste. Bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Hoppy, grassy scent.
Tap at Moeder Lambic. Soapy lemon, light sweetness, great bitterness. Like a more intense xx bitter, but quite soft. A goodun.
On tap at Moeder Lambic. Hazy golden, small white head. Dry and bitter. Earthy hops.

Bottle from systembolaget. Smell is sweet and fresh. Has notes of wheat and flowers. Pours pale orange with a large white head. Taste is bitter and malty and has tones of grapefruit and oranges. Palate is very fresh and smooth. Overall a very nice beer
Bottled:Pours hazy pale orange with a large head.Aroma is floral hops, orange juice and grapefruit.The taste is more floral hops, orange juice and LOADS of bitter grapefruit. Really bitter.

Draught @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Pours hazy golden with airy but stable white head. Clear aroma of hops, malt, flowers and yeast, with some fruity notes. Bitter, intensely hoppy flavour, complemented by subtle fruity, malty and estery touches. Lingering, bitter aftertaste. Really decent but tastes more like a very good mixture of a Plisener and an IPA rather than a Belgian Ale.
@ Nedre Mölla 9/7-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Malty, some hops. Taste: Malty, bitter, some hops, herbal. Body is medium, the finish is dry with high bitterness.

750 ml. Lightly hazed golden body. Huge, meringue-like white head, lasting. Aroma of floral and grassy hops, lemon, citrus, esters, toasted grain. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately to heavily bitter. Medium body, watery texture, dense carbonation. Long, lingering bitterness. Dry finish. Lemon and bitter grass taste. Hops and grains nicely nuanced  no raw dusty grain or leafy hop tastes. Absolutely clean. Excellent beer.

Blonde pour, small white head. Hoppy aroma of pot and grass, with yeasty notes. Flavor is very hoppy. Mostly pot-flavored hops, which are not my favorite, but also with notes of sage, grain, and lemon. Quite crisp.

Flaske, 75 cl. Mørkegul, lavt hvidt skum. Grøn, krydret, let astringerende aroma med noter af græs, hø, blomster, gær, citron og klassiske europæiske humler. Tør, bitter finish , men ikke for bitter og med en sødme i malten, som skaber god balance.

Comes together pretty well with light bitterness and some floral hops. Musky aroma. Light bitter and somewhat astringent. Pours cloudy orange with ok head and lacing. Soft carbonation. Tap at Churchkey.

@ Nedre Mölla. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget (89:-). Malty and quite yeasty with herbs, hay/straw, moderate sweet and heavy bitter, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and bitter. A bit too much bitterness in my opinion.

Pours hazy orange with a massive frothy white head. Aromas of stable, hay, urine, grapefruit, herbs, spices, bitter lemon. Taste is hay, grapefruit, herbs, spices, citrus, hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is sprightly with high carbonation.
DØE, 14. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop and yeast. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, yeast, spicy, medium bitter and a little sweet.

Hazy golden colour, small white head. Aroma is herbal, some bitter hops, mild acidic notes, wood and some spices. Flavour is grassy, herbal, mild toffee and a quite long and nice aftertaste.

75 cl bottle @ PBF IX.
Pours hazy golden color with a large bubbly white head. Soapy aroma, hops, grass and yeast. Lemony fruits and yeast on the flavor, some spice notes, grass and gooseberries, mild hay also. Very nice and aggressive brew, refreshing summer brew.
3345

Bottle 750ml (PBF IX)
Yellow color, small white head. Green, grassy hoppyness in the nose. Medium-bodied. Like XX Bitter it is quite bitter brew. Kind of "green" and grapefruity hoppyness. Long lingering bitterness. Good.

750 ml bottle @ PBF IX. Pours a golden colour with a white small head. Aroma of floral hops, noble hops and herbal notes. Rich flavour of noble hop bitterness, floral notes, pale malts and herbs. Some citrusy notes. Medium bodied and a long, lingering bitter, dry, hoppy finish. Lovely bitterness and with good balance. A vertical tasting with XX Bitter would be interesting.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 75 cl bottle @ PBF ?, BBE 19.02.2019
Aroma is quite mild with grassy hops and some fruity tones (apricot?). Flavour has grassy hops. Balanced, but I expected this to be much more aggressive. Does not differ from XX that much.
7+4+8+3+16=3.8

Draught @ In De Wildeman
Aroma has soapy fruits and hints of herbal hops. Flavour is hoppy with grass, herbs and some citrusy fruits. Perhaps a bit more aggressive on hops than the bottle, but still no big differences with XX.
7+3+8+3+16=3.7
Draught at CBF 2014. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, citrus, hay, spice, yeast and fruit.
750ml bottle. Hazy light amber body with a medium white head. Loads of lacing. Fruity, floral and herbal with a distinct hop and yeast presence.

Aroma: Musty with a little cheesecloth; lemony, herbal hop character leaning toward wild flowers; an undercurrent of citrus- pretty complex nose. Appearance: Hazy, unfiltered royal gold pour with a foamy white head that settles into a bubbly skin. Flavor: Floral and herbal hops lead off with a very lean, crackery malt backbone; very dry and bitter toward the finish, though Id say more of the former. Palate: Full body, thick texture, effervescent carbonation, bitter finishing. Overall: Fascinating stuff- a nice hybrid of Belgian tradition and American-style tendencies.

750ml bottle with a crown cap at home, poured into a tall tulip. ABV 6%
Slighty hazy body, golden orange in colour. Tall white head, thik, soapy, with very good retention, leaving heavy lacing on the glass. 
Aroma of yeast, manure, malts, peaches, lemon zest.
Lots of flower notes, lemon peel, fruity too with peaches, quite bitter taste and even more bitter on the aftertaste with a very long duration.
Body is medium thin with the right amount of carbonation, only mild dryness on the palate.
Very good even when the bitterness seems too much from time to time.

Continental hops in the aroma, some yeast
Taste: bitter, some grapefruit, floral. 
Quite dry and bitter, but not over the top at all. Well balanced.

Bottle 750ml. [ As De Ranke XXX Bitter ].[ Courtesy of Jan ]. Clear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate yeasty, white pepper notes, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass. Initial flavour is moderate sweet and bitter, finish flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, grass, wheat, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140118]

Flaska från SB. Gyllenfärgad, disis, stort vitt bestående skum. Stor doft av belgisk jäst, gräs, hö, örter, kryddig men också en citrusblommig fruktighet. Lätt och elegant och örtigt kärv på samma gång. Frisk, torr, välhumlad, lätt honungssötma, syrliga och lätt beska äpplen, citrus, koriander. Perfekt på midsommarbordet. Jag älskar xx bitter och det här är ändå bättre. Så bra balans, så fina smaker, ovanligt välhumlat och ändå typisk belgiskt. Ett nytt favoritöl.

Pours a clear golden body with a thick head. Lightly funky aroma with a bitter, hoppy taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smak och doft av humle, vete, gröna äpplen, belgisk jäst, citrus med toner av honung, koriander, hö, apelsin och grapefrukt. Jämn och fin med tydlig beska med smak av citrusskal. Riktigt gott och uppfriskande.

Bottle. Nose is floral, musty, cloves, slight orange peel. Intriguing. Taste, is resin, grapefruit rind, floral, slight herbal, cloves and lots of pepper in the lasting dry finish, finish. Mouthfeel is good.

Nice beer which clearly has links to new world IPAs but Im a little baffled by the hype.

750ml green bottle, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with a medium sized frothy beige head, that reduced quickly leaving a little lacing on the glass. Aroma of orange peels, lemon zest, pears and peaches. Flavours of lemon zest, orange peels and spices. Taste is light sweet and medium-heavy bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall a great beer, nice dry citrusy bitterness, notably more bitter than a typical Belgian Ale.

28th May 2014Tasting at Chez Bruce. Thanks to Pau for this one. Hazy gold beer, good pale cream coloured head. Palate is light and dry and mildly crisp. Light floral start. Fresh air malts. Bitterish grapefruit and a touch of bitter aniseed. Light dry finish with a good bitter linger. All right.

Tap. Fresh meadow aroma mostly of lavender and clover; fragrant and musky; cobwebs, gravel.

Super bitter, floral hop flavor with light, balancing acidity and honey malt.
Open, airy palate disguises the crazy dryness of this thing, and leaves me wanting a mite more body.

Yeasty, citric, grapefruity, resinous, tart, bread, hay, Green apples, horse blanket. Hazy golden colour, medium white head, lacing. 
Medium bite, mid-sweet, lots of funky yeast, sort of one-dimensional. 
Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter and bready finish.
Well made, but nothing that really excites me.
Nose is decent mediumsweet lemon, yeast, banana whiff, elder flower, cooked vegetables, feel is mediumwatery, taste is white beans sweetness, yellow pepper, gooseberry acidity, late weak bile

Bottle shared with friends @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: hazy blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: nice bitterness and grassy notes. Taste: good balance of malt and hops, grassy and floral notes. Some yeast notes. Aftertaste: dry bitterness sensation.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours lightly hazy yellow-gold with a lingering, frothy off-white head. The nose has pleasant, understated Belgian yeast expression, light grass, pale doughy bread, hay. Light sweet flavor with nice, salty pale bread, somewhat assertive grassy hops, lemon rind. Light to medium bodied with soft, massaging carbonation. Grassy bitter finish with Lilly offsetting pale bread, more lemon rind. Nice but the bitterness is a bit much in the end.

Bottle shared at Bruces. It pours clear golden with a thick white head. The nose is fresh, doughy, pretty spice, hay, toasted grass, light pear and sweet apple notes. The taste is crisp, doughy, hay, spice, grass, light alcohol, decent bitterness, pepper and a touch of citrus rind with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Nice bitter Belgian number.
Draught at KØ14. Fruity aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Good creamy white head. The flavour is malty, sweet but not sugary. Good bitterness, not too much. Creamy mouthfeel.

Sample from tap, CBF 2014. Clear, golden colour with a medium sized, white head. Fruity aroma with spices, fruits, hay, yeasts and citrus. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes dry and bitter with a very pleasant fruitiness. Good one.
Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy, white foam. Medium carbonation. Complex bitter beer. Notes of citrus with dry bitter finish. Very well balanced. Easy drinkable.

From tap @ Delirium. yellow golden blond, misty, small white head. nose: floral hoppy nose, gentle, subtile, nice and fresh. taste: yeast, hoppy taste, the power of this beer lies in, for me, the finish. Bitter, or what did you expect? Nice gently dry bitterness, not the one that takes you to the throat. But one that is nice, long and stretched. good overall MF. Before the finish, I have somehting that looks like want to be a sweet streak, adds to the complexity of the beer. Very round and rich. Great beer, subtile, complex, this one is not only bitter, this is one to discover. Step by step, on a long journey.

Harsh belgian yeast, carbonation in your face, herbal bitterness screaming. This is not a beginners beer. And thats only the start because as soon as you set your lips to this blond bodied bastard the bitterness dries out your tongue and does a little mash pit on the taste buds. American (I)IPAs can be bitter but almost always break out a caramel and sweet malt push -- De Ranke thinks nothing of that. No, this is not a balanced beer. Yes, it is hugely carbonated. I love it like I love a raw punk song or a scorching hot Tom Yum. (75cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Clear pale golden, rocky white head
citric, hops, some cereals, simple malts, freshness
light refreshing maltiness, citruses, malts, a bitter ending which evolves without getting overwelming in the aftertaste

Given my fondness for De Ranke in general and for De Ranke in particular, I was intrigued when this came out but never thought Id get a chance to try it. Im very glad I did. Pours yellow with a fluffy white head into a Duvel tulip. Nose of dusty, peppery European hops -- Hallertau? -- seriously earthy, amply floral, a sour grassy aroma coming up behind, just a hint of Belgian yeast (it could use more of this character, I think) and the slightest note of alcohol. Flavor is a blast of grassy earthy hops, like a pilsner on roids (but much better than a US imperial pils!), flowery fields and a touch of soap. Bitter oils linger long on the tongue like grapefruit pith but not citric like the juice or peel. Mild malt sweetness of stone-ground wheat thins is there early in the long side of the finish. Early on this is easy enough to drink, though there is a just a bit of heat from the mere 6% abv. Halfway through the bottle palate fatigue sets in and Ive got to dock it a point from the overall for that. This one is close enough to the XX than I cant say much about the difference between them without trying them head-to-head. Im not sure this one would break into a regular rotation even if it was readily available, but its very enjoyable to try on a one-time basis.

Brilliant golden. Billowy, tightly packed white head holds quite well. Remarkably bright and clean aromas of zippy phenols, sage, lilac, sherbet, potpourri, pastry cream, minerals, lemon zest, fennel seed, gum, pepper, dusty yeast. Highly perfumey, as well. Dense, soft, and fluffy carbonation. Hops immediately unleash a refined succulence, with a burst of mouth-filling oils and their zingy acids colliding with an appetizing assortment of fierce pepper and coarse herbs. Hop character is teemingly flavorsome, immeasurably deep in its purity, and chock full of sweet, bright nectars. Dusty, plastery yeast bolsters the lean core with a rustic signature which beautifully contrasts with the vividly defined, squeaky clean pils malt. Very lean and deceptively simple malt fills out the body with chewy starches, as does the creamy, plastery yeast. Sophisticated hoppiness continually captivates with a staggeringly complex fusion of lemon zest, flower petals, pepper, herbs, you name it. Immaculately attenuated finish showcases bouncy, lightly toasted hay textures underscored by an invigorating assortment of feisty, bracingly bitter hops and a spirited phenolic flourish. Another stunner from the folks at De Ranke. Much like XX Bitter in its unbridled hop onslaught, but with slightly more hop depth, if thats conceivable. This features all the hoppy elegance and succulence that only late-hopping can seem to achieve (why do so many brewers seem to favor dry-hopping when they can thoroughly coax bright aromatics and depth of flavor via the sole technique of late-hopping?). Elegant yet rustic; idiosyncratic but oh so focused. It truly mystifies how a hoppy golden beer at eight months of age can still brim with a vitality of this magnitude. But I suppose thats the magical thing about pedigreed Belgian yeast strains and the way some brewers knows how to work them, as they can handily  endure the rigors of oxidation like few others are able. I can only imagine what this must have been like uber fresh. Hell of a beer!

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Draft through a few glasses to make a session. Lightly hazed effervescent gold with a fine-bubbled rocky white head. Persimmon, kiwifruit, sage, grass, flowers, apricot, orange blossom, lemon, basement must, almost-mold. Pithy strong bitterness and a dry pale malt core give this one an intense hoppiness that would be excessive for me if it the hops werent so vibrant and gloriously juicy, zingy and floral. Doughy / bready pale malt gives it the smell of an active bakery... De Ranke yeast once again gives this beer a softness and rusticity that is really rare to find in beer, not just Belgian ales. Soft body, creamy soft carbonation, bitter, off-dry, wonderfully expressive. Another winner for me on first taste, though I leave it open for bottle samples (i always assume that bottle fermentation gives Belgian beer added punch and life from the yeast). With how quiet nose is on this draft sample I cant wait to get a full effervescent pour from a fresh bottle. When they will show up in CO who knows. In short, it compares very well with XX but has noticeably more bitterness and thankfully little else different, at least not different enough to notice without doing a side by side. That will come if CO ever sees bottles. I do suspect that the draft pour is less yeasty, seems that way from what I recall of the last few batches of XX. I love De Ranke yeast but maybe I love its quieter character in this amazingly hopped Belgian blonde. (4.4)

text: Towering, very dense & fine yellowish head with lace over very well-carbonated veiled orange-ochre beer. Dry hops and summer grain. Sweet malts set off by fragrant, discreet hoparomas. Bit of gouache paint. Very bitter, ultra-dry, but quite tasty brew; main body is sweeter-malty, even cornflakes-like for an instant, but the finish is a near-wood, near-tanninelike bitterness, again ultra-dry.
